title: Academic Vocabulary Practice - B2/C1
description: Comprehensive gap-fill exercises for academic writing and speaking

sentences.text: The minister _____ that new environmental policies would take effect immediately.

The witness _____ under oath that he had seen the defendant at the scene.
He _____ his disagreement with the proposed changes to the policy.
The report _____ that climate change poses significant risks to agriculture.
She _____ that the project would be completed ahead of schedule.
sentences.hint: Say that something is true (but may be disputed)

sentences.text: The professor _____ throughout the course that critical thinking was essential.
sentences.hint: Firmly keep or defend an opinion

sentences.text: At the end of the presentation, he _____ that further research was needed.

sentences.hint: Try to reach an agreement through discussion

sentences.text: We enjoyed _____ with the locals about their traditional customs.

sentences.hint: Think and talk carefully about options

sentences.text: Experts _____ fiercely over the best approach to solve the crisis.

sentences.hint: Have a formal discussion or meeting

sentences.text: I strongly _____ that education is the key to social mobility.
sentences.hint: Think something is true with conviction

sentences.text: We should _____ all the options before making a final decision.

sentences.hint: Think something may be true (with doubt)
